comment: Professor Nicholson does have very clear grading criteria. 50% of your grade is watching 10 videos and reading 5 chapters of a book and writing 500-word summaries with questions. However, the class is graded on only 4 tests. Your lowest test is NO LONGER dropped effective Fall 2022. These tests are 80 questions 80 minutes Lockdown browser. Study!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Made history about as interesting as it could be, he does great lectures that have a ton of info to supplement the presentation slides. Grade is based on 4 tests (lowest grade dropped) and 15 500 word writing assignments that are well spaced out, usually 1 or 2 a week and not critically graded, mostly you get a 100 if you got it done.

Easy class but he is lazy and does not care about students. Lectures are boring and less informative than the book. During midterms, he sent out an email with the time the test is available and said and questions should be directed to IT. He was on vacation and ignored everybody's emails. His students are insignificant to him and he makes it clear.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Good teacher and good guy. There are 10 video essays (about 500 words each) and 4 or 5 500 word essays about one of the books. The class is very lecture heavy, but his lectures aren't bad. Study for the tests, and you should be able to find quizlets online for his class (he reuses some test questions). I made an A with medium effort.

Dr. Nicholson was an amazing professor. You can tell he really cares about you learn gin history and not just history statistics. You do have 10 2page papers to write throughout the semester, but they are pretty easy. If you put forth somewhat of effort you will be fine. Wish all professors cared like him!
Great professor, very caring and you can tell that he truly wants you to succeed! Take this professor if you can he really does help you in your college career, very easy class.

Amazing lectures, avoids opinionated statements, sticks to every letter of the syllabus, stays on subject, always on time, extensively knowledgeable. Lots of writing, but won't count off for grammar or other simple nonsense. Only pass/fail grades on writings. Prepares you for tests. No final. Wonderful man and best history professor I've ever had.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Here is how the class goes: you take 4 80 question tests that are half based on his power points and half form the text book.  He doesn't make you read the textbook but I highly suggested opening it.  Then the only other grades are 10 video responses/ 5 chapter responses in a book he makes you read through out the semester.  He is great professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You could tell he wanted the best for each student. 4 80-question tests, but they were not difficult if you studied the review slides. Also gives you the opportunity to replace the lowest test grade with a paper at the end of the semester. Takes attendance so you must show up. Overall I would absolutely recommend.

Awesome professor! There are 4 tests in total worth 20% each. Then there are video responses and loewen responses throughout the semester that are very easy which are equal to the last 20% of the grade. He offers an optional essay at the end of the semester to replace your lowest test grade. Show up to class and sign in. Lots of lectures.

Best professor I've had! If you go to class and study, it's an easy A. Video responses help your grade, and you can make half credit if your a little late. Study the review words, and read the Loewen book. He gives extra credit at the end, and ALWAYS responds to emails, and keeps you up to date with your grade!

Good professor, very nice and generally entertaining. You watch lots of videos in class & responses to them are always due 2 days after watching. 4 exams, no cumulative final, with an optional essay due at the end of the semester to replace your lowest exam grade. Study all the terms he puts at the end of his powerpoint and you'll be fine!

Professor Nicholson was a pleasure to have as a professor! History is not my strong subject at all but his lectures were entertaining and that man is hilarious!! Read the chapter before class so you know what is going on. You're allowed to use your laptop, allowed 3 absences from class. His tests are fairly easy if you study. Take Nicholson!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Fantastic teacher with a great sense of humor. If you have perfect attendance, he'll add 2 points to your final grade. He has (3) 80-question scantron tests & a dozen 1-paragraph video/book chapter responses that make up his grading & he offers extra credit. His tests are super easy & he makes learning fun. I recommend taking his class if you can.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Definitely attend the lecture, you don't have to read the book to pass but it'll definitely help. Literally all you have to do to get A's on the tests is look at the review slides he posts at the end of each chapter. Know those topics only and you will ace the tests. He is so adorable, very informed about this subject, Easy A
Easy class, 4 tests,each 80 easy questions, study the day before, read the book,do the assignments and you ll get an A

Great professor! Very clear with assignments and answers back quickly to emails. Assigns 5, one paragraph responses to a book which is really easy and offers an optional writing assignment at the end of the semester if you need to raise your grade. Very funny in lectures and keeps students interested.
Dr. Nicholson is pretty much exactly what you would expect from a history professor.  Great professor and would definitely take him again.

He has one joke that is somehow funny every time he does it. He is the most interesting history professor I have had. You are inspired by his passion in the subject. I hate history and I still found this class very interesting and even looked forward to it. The book he teaches with is a real eye opener. Take him if you want to actually learn

Nicholson is a great professor. All I did was print out the review slides and take notes according to them. Aced every test. Make sure you write up the videoloewen responses and you'll do fine. And SHOW UP. His lectures cover more than the power points show and you'll need the information he has.

Super easy class. He posts all the power points online and doesn't take attendance. You really don't have to show up except for tests. The lectures are actually pretty entertaining and he's a funny guy. His test are 80 multiple choice questions from the lecture. You don't need the textbook, but you need the Loewen book.

I really enjoyed this class and the way Prof Nicholson teached.  He tried to make class fun, you do need to show up as he takes points off your final grade if you miss too many classes. There are 10 video responses and 4 group responses, all very easy. Four tests which questions come mostly from class notes and discussions. Easy A/B if you attend.

Professor Nicholson was probably my favorite professor. He's very organized, clear, and precise in his instructions w/r/t the work assigned in class. 4 tests, multiple choice, not cumulative. 10 video responses due for the semester (not hard, 1 page each), but if you complete those all, you can get Bs on all the tests and still get an A.

Great professor. I learned a lot at an appropriate level. The Class is doable without reading but it would deeply help with the understanding of the content. The professor is a great guy who is really passionate about teaching. Highly recommended course.

Great Professor! History is never a fun subject but he makes the class really interesting and you can tell he loves his jobs which something we need in the school systems now a days. Keep up with your reading and come to class and you'll do fine. He is always available to give you suggestions too as to how to improve and there's extra credit.
He knows the information however, for the test you have to rely heavily on your book. He makes history interesting. Overall, he is a good professor he just is not the easiest. READ THE BOOK

He needs to be teaching kids in middle school. He HAS to have his notes in front of him or he gets sidetracked & gives the most boring lectures. Says that his tests are from the PPs he gives (which are useless) but they're not, they're from the book. READ YOUR BOOK. The study guides are always out of order and his tests are hard. GOOD LUCK

Great professor. Made history interesting. Opportunity to gain extra points with completing additional responses that are due weekly. I enjoy watching weekly videos. It is evident that the professor enjoys teaching, he also has a sense of humor. You will enjoy his class.  Exams are on topic, take notes, complete study guide and you will do well.
Very easy to get along with. Good personality, loves to teach.
Though I've never been interested in History, Dr. Nicholson made it interesting.  He gives great reviews and alot of video responses.

I loved his class. Although the lectures can get a bit boring at times, it is obvious he knows what he is talking about and enjoys it. He gives a very helpful study guide for each test and as long as you study that, you will be fine. Book is not really needed but having mine to study was helpful

Really nice teacher, probably one of the better ones at KSU. Tests aren't the easiest, but if you study you'll do fine. Essay at the end of the semester to replace lowest test and 2 bonus points if you don't miss class (or get a friend to sign you in). Highly recommended.

Textbook isn't absolutely necessary (free pdf version can be found online). All content is on GaView. Can turn in assignments via email/GaView. Is very clear on expectations and requirements. 6 absences before grade is affected. Extra credit if no absences. Good guy, good class.
Nicholson is a great professor. There's an outline HERE of what the entire class is like. (Grading, assignments, etc.)so you can see EXACTLY what his class will be like. Take him. Trust me.
Dr. Nicholson is a fair professor. He covers all material for tests. Use the study guide and come to class and you will do well in this class.
Prof. Nicholas has a way of keeping your attention and making history interesting.  If you come to class & complete the study guides, you will make a good grade.

Good teacher for this class.  Mandatory class attendance, but does allow six absences. One paper. Four tests and optional final, but drops lowest test grade.  If you show up, pay attention and take notes, its you can make a good grade.  I would recommend the class.
He was a fairly easy teacher. History is my hardest subject and with his powerpoints and such really helped me understand the material for his class.

Awesome Professor...go to class, take notes, read the material and do the study guide and you can make an "A". He makes history very interesting because he knows the material. 4 tests, 1 paper and a final..he will drop a test grade. Do good on the first 3 tests and the paper and you will not have to take test 4 or the final.

Dr. Nicholson was a great instructor. You could tell he really enjoys history. I would take him again, but you have to use the text, take notes and come to class. One 4-5 page essay, but it was fairly easy if you do good research, he is big on grammer! Tests are all multiple choice, and he drops 1 of the four tests.

Easy class. Prof makes it easy to make an A. I didn't put forth much effort into the class and got an A. The paper is an easy grade if you pick a subject you already know something about. Not the most interesting class I have taken, but very easy.

When I think of a professor at a college this is who I think of. He knew his subject taught it well and took no crap from the kids in the class. I like his attendance rule. After 4 classes missed it counts a letter grade. Show up, pay attention, learn something and pass.

Great teacher! 4 tests, a paper, and an optional final. He takes your best 4 grades (including the paper). If you know everything on the study guide you'll do just fine on the tests. If you never miss a class he adds 2 points to your final grade. My worst subject is history and i made an A!
Nice guy. Teaches from PowerPoint and videos. 4 tests and a paper. Provides a study guide for every test. I have a 2.75 and I got a B in his class.

EXCELLENT professor!  Is passionate about the subject and very knowledgeable!  Keeps it interesting with videos, etc.  Offers study guides that are linked to exams.  Paper/presentation requirement and final is not mandatory if happy with grade after 3rd test.  Highly recommend and wished he taught World History too!

Amazing professor, he tells you exactly what you need to know, optional final exam, extra credit if you attend every class. Drops lowest test grade, and one paper. Awesome teacher and he knows his stuff.

4 multiple choice tests questions mostly from the reading, no comprehensive final, drops lowest grade, 1 report or oral presentation (very easy), lectures are boring, attendance is mandatory, go to class and read the book, easy A.

Professor Nicholson is one of the best professor in KSU, though his class might be a lil bit boring sometime, but go to class even if your going to sleep cuz attendance is mandatory. he gives 4 test, no final! and drop the lowest grade, gives extra credit for attendance. I made 2 D's and a 'C' on the test and end up pulling out 'B' overall in class

he is incredibly knowledgeable on the subject. however,all he teaches from are bullet pt powerpoints & lectures straight from them, so if you're an audible learner i wouldnt recommend his class. notes arent online, tests easy if you study & mandatory attendance.

I don't really know what the person below me is talking about :-p. Nicholson is SO nice. Yes, he doesn't have time to get detailed, but he does know his stuff. Class is interesting and tests aren't too hard, neither is the primary documents project. I recommend him :).

Doesn't appear to know anything about the subject taught. During his "lectures," he essentially copies and pastes bulletpoints on to a Powerpoint presentation, then reads them with little explanation, and is often unable to even define what a given bulletpoint is or means. Recommend using: textbook, encyclopedia and Google. Avoid when possible.

attendance is mandatory which is annoying because sometimes all he does is play pointless videos and listen to presentation. There are 4 tests and a presentation grade. Don't slack on the tests because low grades will bring you down. You don't have to pay attention as long as you extensively complete and study the study guide before test days.

I have to say that I have never taken a history class that I could say I actually enjoyed until now.  Dr. Nicholson really knows his stuff and is very passionate about his subject!  This was not a hard class at all if you just go to class and study the information on the study guide.  I loved this class!  :)

I love history, so I enjoyed this class. If you are not a history lover, you might be bored...but Dr. Nicholson is a great prof and very fair. Show up to class, take good notes from the powerpoints, and you'll make an A. Tests were NOT hard--you just have to study. Grade also includes a presentation or a paper. Both are painless.
Great teacher! Attendance is mandatory. Easy class if you listen to lectures and use the study guide. If not, why did you sign up for college.

If you are interested in American history, definitely take this class with him. He's a fun teacher, knows his stuff, and will start telling personal stories when you get on the 1960's-70's (which are very entertaining). 4 tests and an easy presentation, drops the lowest test grade.
Intersting Class lots of reading Tests are multiple choice and Essay as long as you read chapters you should do well in class. also has an oral project that is fairly painless and easy.
Great Professor, easy class. Very important to read the chapter for a test. Study Guides are given with the exact info on the test.

Tests are hard, you HAVE to study because they consist of writing entirely.  He is a great lecturer and makes the subject very interesting.  If you want an easy A, this is not the class for you, but you will learn a lot.

He's a good guy with a lot of knowledge.  Keep up with the reading & you'll be fine.  The study guides are also helpful for the tests which are identification, lisitng & short answer & an essay. The presentation is an easy way to make an A. I'd take him again.
great guy, hard test, work hard study book and you'll do fine.

The material is tedious and the tests are a bit tricky, but if you actually put a tiny bit of effort in, you'll get a B. I never cracked open the books and managed to get B's just from what he said in class. VERY sweet and laid back, doesn't have any outside assignments. I would definitely take him again if I could. My fav professor so far.

Dr. Nicholson is probably the best history professor I've had yet! He's a nice, easy going personality who knows way too much about history, and teaches it like a story. The tests are not easy, but if you attend lecture and read the book you'll be fine. It was a lot of work, but not impossible by any means, to make an A.
He is good. Not a difficult class. He is nice too.

He makes an effort to make class interesting, and I enjoyed his lectures.  The presentation is an easy A, which is nice because I wouldn't call his tests easy.  He does give you a study guide, but there is material on the test that may not be in the study guide.  Reading the book is necessary to do well in his class.  Not too hard, not too easy.

Dr. Nicholson is truly a great professor.  He gives you a study guide and great notes!!  His lectures are very helpful and interesting, tests are thorough but easy if you pay attention and do the assigned readings.  I recommend him!

Dr. Nicholson is very smart. And he tries really hard to make the class interesting. There is an attendance policy and an 8 minute speech that counts as a test grade. But class really isn't that hard. He's a nice guy and if you study the study guide, you'll do well on the tests.

Main job teaching high school and teaches like a high school teacher would. Tests are throughough (especially the essay part!) Classes are tolerable but does require useless group activites every class

good professor...decently easy class if you just read the chapter and the documents. he gives a good outline and goes over the chapter in class. the tests are straightforward if you come to class and review notes.
He is very helpful, execelent teacher. we just need to read the chapter before class, he explaines in detaille every topic.

He is very fair.  Read the book and go to class and do a fair amount of looking over your notes and you'll do good.  He has 2 projects that aren't too bad. just make sure you check the dates on the documents you use.  He writes outline on the board which makes it very easy to follow him in class.

Excellent professor.  Very helpful and isn't strict about making up quizzes.  Quizzes are fairly easy, but mid-term and final exams are a little harder.  Read all of the assigned chapters and you'll do fine.
